{"step_by_step_thinking": "Thyroid storm is a severe, life-threatening condition caused by an excess of thyroid hormone. A variety of events can trigger a thyroid storm, including surgery. Poor antibiotic coverage is not directly related to thyroid hormone levels. Rough handling during surgery could potentially cause a release of thyroid hormones, but it is not the most likely cause. Removal of the parathyroid glands can lead to hypocalcemia, but not a thyroid storm.
